alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 8:42PM MST until January 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW OVER THE PLAINS... .Snow, heavy at times, will continue over the plains through midnight and then slowly decrease. Further west along the I-25 Corridor and across the higher terrain light snow will continue this evening before ending around midnight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Icy roads will make travel very difficult to impossible. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
